title: Potential Buffer Overflow in SHGetFolderPath
description: The function SHGetFolderPath is used to retrieve the path of a special folder, but it does not check if the buffer provided (szPath) is large enough. This can lead to a buffer overflow if the path length exceeds MAX_PATH.
fix: Use the newer SHGetKnownFolderPath function which provides better handling for longer paths and returns a pointer to a string that must be freed with CoTaskMemFree.
